page.title: 16FARMING : Livestock
page.content: On the farm,cultivated crops are grown as the soil is grade 1 and very suitable for arable farming.However, there is still livestock as during the winter the farmer buys in cattle from the local market.On average 250 are bought in to be fattened up during the winter and sold again in the spring. The cattle are kept inside during the winter and fed on grain and hayledge grown on the land.The farm also has 170 breeding sheep which are constantly on the farm.Their lambs, when born in the spring,are all taken and sold at the market.The highest price for them is in May at the beginning of the season,but the price gradually drops as more lambs become available.All the lambing takes place indoors over a period of 4 weeks and needs constant attention.
